content:
<ce:para id="p0015" view="all">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold> is constructed from 1,2,4,5-tetrakis(3-carboxyphenyl)-benzene (<ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>TCPB) (
<ce:float-anchor refid="sch0005"></ce:float-anchor>), which can be straightforwardly synthesized by the coupling and hydrolysis reaction, from its precursor. A mixture of Cu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) and <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>TCPB (0.01<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g) was dissolved in N, N′-diethylformamide (DEF, 1.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), water (0.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), and con. HCl (8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>μL). The final mixture was placed in a 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL glass vial, which was sealed and heated at 75<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 24<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, and then cooled to room temperature. Rhombus-shaped turquoise crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were collected in 42% yield (based on ligand <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>TCPB). Anal. calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">49</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">55</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 57.64; H, 5.43; and N, 4.12. Found: C, 57.70; H, 5.46; and N, 4.17. IR/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>: 2972 (m), 1615 (m), 1538 (s), 1395 (s), 1371 (s), 820(m), 767 (s), and 710(s). It was formulated on the bases of single-crystal X-ray structure determination, elemental analysis, and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA). A single-crystal X-ray crystallographic study revealed that <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> crystallizes in the monoclinic system and C2/c space group . As quite frequently observed in MOFs, the framework contains paddle-wheel binuclear {Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(COO)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>} secondary building units (a<ce:float-anchor refid="f0005"></ce:float-anchor>), which are bridged by organic <ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-TCPB ligands to form a two-dimensional (2D) hexagonal grid {Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(<ce:italic>m</ce:italic>-TCPB)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>} (b). The adjacent 2D hexagonal grid is packed in parallel, leading to the final porous-containing three-dimensional (3D) frameworks with the cavities of 8.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>×<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>12.6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>Å<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup> (d). The structure of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> is non-interpenetrated and the topology (Fig. S2) can be best described as a simple 4, 4 connected net (c, d), which exhibits the same topology as well-established MOFs, such as: MOF-2 Zn(BDC)-(DMF), Cu(BDC-OH), Zn<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(TBAPy), and UTSA-72 . The fifth coordination sites of paddle–wheel Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(COO)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf> units were occupied by water molecules, which will be critical for the gas-absorption selectivity. Upon water molecules removal, the open sites will be exposed for other applications. The solvent accessible volume after the removal of the uncoordinated solvents is 59.6% calculated with PLATON .</ce:para>
clean_text: 1 is constructed from 1,2,4,5-tetrakis(3-carboxyphenyl)-benzene (m-H4TCPB) ( ), which can be straightforwardly synthesized by the coupling and hydrolysis reaction, from its precursor. A mixture of Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (0.02g) and m-H4TCPB (0.01g) was dissolved in N, N'-diethylformamide (DEF, 1.5mL), water (0.4mL), and con. HCl (8μL). The final mixture was placed in a 20mL glass vial, which was sealed and heated at 75°C for 24h, and then cooled to room temperature. Rhombus-shaped turquoise crystals of 1 were collected in 42% yield (based on ligand m-H4TCPB). Anal. calcd for C49H55O13N3Cu2: C, 57.64; H, 5.43; and N, 4.12. Found: C, 57.70; H, 5.46; and N, 4.17. IR/cm-1: 2972 (m), 1615 (m), 1538 (s), 1395 (s), 1371 (s), 820(m), 767 (s), and 710(s). It was formulated on the bases of single-crystal X-ray structure determination, elemental analysis, and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA). A single-crystal X-ray crystallographic study revealed that 1 crystallizes in the monoclinic system and C2/c space group . As quite frequently observed in MOFs, the framework contains paddle-wheel binuclear {Cu2(COO)4} secondary building units (a), which are bridged by organic m-TCPB ligands to form a two-dimensional (2D) hexagonal grid {Cu2(m-TCPB)2} (b). The adjacent 2D hexagonal grid is packed in parallel, leading to the final porous-containing three-dimensional (3D) frameworks with the cavities of 8.5×12.6Å2 (d). The structure of 1 is non-interpenetrated and the topology (Fig. S2) can be best described as a simple 4, 4 connected net (c, d), which exhibits the same topology as well-established MOFs, such as: MOF-2 Zn(BDC)-(DMF), Cu(BDC-OH), Zn2(TBAPy), and UTSA-72 . The fifth coordination sites of paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 units were occupied by water molecules, which will be critical for the gas-absorption selectivity. Upon water molecules removal, the open sites will be exposed for other applications. The solvent accessible volume after the removal of the uncoordinated solvents is 59.6% calculated with PLATON .
